description: Chromatic number of path with n nodes.
comments: This cannot be the ordinary chromatic number, which is 2 for paths and 2 or 3 for cycles (A006671). Should "edge-distinguishing" be in the title? - Keith Briggs (keith.briggs(AT)bt.com), Feb 22 2006
references: K. Al-Wahabi, R. Bari, F. Harary and D. Ullman, The edge-distinguishing chromatic number of paths and cycles, pp. 17-22 of Graph Theory in Memory of G. A. Dirac (Sandbjerg, 1985). Edited by L. D. Andersen et al., Annals of Discrete Mathematics, 41. North-Holland Publishing Co., Amsterdam-New York, 1989.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
